com.esri.mo2.sys.spi
Class Provider

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.esri.mo2.sys.spi.Provider
public class Provider
extends Object

This class will return a set of service provider class names for a given service interface, by searching the CLASSPATH for registered "service providers". This is the basic idea behind the MOJava "plug-in" architecture.

The primary strategy used by Provider is to use java.lang.ClassLoader.getResources() and search for any or all files located in the "META-INF/services" folder that match the required interface name. This strategy will normally work fine, provided the JVM run-time does not restrict access to ClassLoader resources.

In case of security issues, ClassLoader normally finds no results, so Provider uses a "backup" strategy of searching for a regular resource file located in the resource folder identified by SPI_BACKUP_RESOURCE_PATH and (once again) having the same name as the requested service interface. In this case, only a single resource file is obtained. This means that to add a custom implementation of a particular plug-in interface, a developer must edit and replace the relevant resource file. A desktop utility named DeployPlugin is provided to make this easier.

Field Summary
static String SPI_BACKUP_RESOURCE_PATH
          this is the resource folder of service provider resource files that is searched only if the "normal" search for service providers fails, possibly because of some security reason.

Field Detail

SPI_BACKUP_RESOURCE_PATH

public static final String SPI_BACKUP_RESOURCE_PATH
this is the resource folder of service provider resource files that is searched only if the "normal" search for service providers fails, possibly because of some security reason. The value of this string is "/com/esri/mo2/res/spi/"

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Method Detail

isAnyServiceProviderAvailable

public static boolean isAnyServiceProviderAvailable(String interfaceName)
checks if at least one service provider for the given interface can be found on the current CLASSPATH and returns true if at least one is available, false if none.

Parameters:
interfaceName - the full class path of the interface for which providers are being searched
Returns:
true if at least one is available, false if none
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if interfaceName is null or empty string

getProviderClassNames

public static Iterator getProviderClassNames(String interfaceName)
                                      throws IOException
obtains a list of class names that are defined as implementations of the given interface name via service provider definition files, and returns a read-only iterator of the class names found. Each object produced by iterator.next() is guaranteed to be a String. The content of each provider String is not checked. But, if a '#' character is found in the input provider text, it is treated as a comment mark, and all subsequent characters (including the '#') are ignored until end-of-line is reached. Leading and trailing white space characters are also trimmed.

Parameters:
interfaceName - the full class path of the interface for which providers are being found
Returns:
an Iterator containing the implementing class names (if any)
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if interfaceName is null or empty string
IOException - for any problem reading the CLASSPATH

getProviderObjects

public static Iterator getProviderObjects(String interfaceName)
                                   throws IOException,
                                          ClassNotFoundException
obtains a list of service provider class names using getProviderClassNames, then attempts to construct an object for each of these classes. A list of objects that have been successfully constructed is returned via an Iterator. Each object produced by the iterator.next() is guaranteed to be an object of type "interfaceName". Strings that are malformed, or that do not represent a valid class, or connot be successfully instantiated are ignored.

Parameters:
interfaceName - the full class path of the interface for which providers are being found
Returns:
an Iterator containing the provider implementation objects (if any)
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if interfaceName is null or empty string
IOException - for any problem reading the CLASSPATH
ClassNotFoundException - if the class named "interfaceName" cannot be located
See Also:
getProviderClassNames(java.lang.String)
